trans-unit.source: Get started with SQL Database | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Get started with SQL Database | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Create your first cloud database in minutes with Azure SQL Database, Microsoft's relational database management service (RDBMS) in the cloud, using the Azure portal and the AdventureWorks sample database.
trans-unit.target: Create your first cloud database in minutes with Azure SQL Database, Microsoft's relational database management service (RDBMS) in the cloud, using the Azure portal and the AdventureWorks sample database.

trans-unit.source: Create your first Azure SQL database
trans-unit.target: Create your first Azure SQL database

trans-unit.source: Single database
trans-unit.target: Single database

trans-unit.source: This article shows you how to create a sample SQL database in just a few minutes using the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: This article shows you how to create a sample SQL database in just a few minutes using the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: You'll learn how to:
trans-unit.target: You'll learn how to:

trans-unit.source: Create a server to host the database you create, and then set up a firewall rule for it
trans-unit.target: Create a server to host the database you create, and then set up a firewall rule for it

trans-unit.source: Create a database from an AdventureWorks sample, which has data that you can play with
trans-unit.target: Create a database from an AdventureWorks sample, which has data that you can play with

trans-unit.source: You'll need an Azure account and subscription before you start.
trans-unit.target: You'll need an Azure account and subscription before you start.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have one, sign up for a <link><linkText>free trial</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have one, sign up for a <link><linkText>free trial</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Sign in and start SQL database set up
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Sign in and start SQL database set up

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <link><linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <link><linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Click New > Data + Storage > SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: Click New > Data + Storage > SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create a new SQL database</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create a new SQL database</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The SQL Database settings blade that appears is where you'll set up the server and database details.
trans-unit.target: The SQL Database settings blade that appears is where you'll set up the server and database details.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Database and server settings for SQL database</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Database and server settings for SQL database</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Choose server settings
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Choose server settings

trans-unit.source: A SQL database in Azure lives on a database server.
trans-unit.target: A SQL database in Azure lives on a database server.

trans-unit.source: A server can host multiple databases.
trans-unit.target: A server can host multiple databases.

trans-unit.source: As you set up a database, you can also create and set up the server that will host it, or you can use one that was created earlier.
trans-unit.target: As you set up a database, you can also create and set up the server that will host it, or you can use one that was created earlier.

trans-unit.source: We'll set up a new one.
trans-unit.target: We'll set up a new one.

trans-unit.source: Type a Name for your database (we use AdventureWorks).
trans-unit.target: Type a Name for your database (we use AdventureWorks).

trans-unit.source: We'll come back to cover other database settings later.
trans-unit.target: We'll come back to cover other database settings later.

trans-unit.source: Under Server click Configure required settings, and then click Create a new server.
trans-unit.target: Under Server click Configure required settings, and then click Create a new server.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Name your database</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Name your database</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the New server blade, type a Server Name that's unique throughout Azure and easy to remember.
trans-unit.target: In the New server blade, type a Server Name that's unique throughout Azure and easy to remember.

trans-unit.source: You'll need this name later when you connect and work with your database.
trans-unit.target: You'll need this name later when you connect and work with your database.

trans-unit.source: Type a Server admin login that's easy to remember (we use AdventureAdmin).
trans-unit.target: Type a Server admin login that's easy to remember (we use AdventureAdmin).

trans-unit.source: Then type a secure Password and type it again in Confirm password.
trans-unit.target: Then type a secure Password and type it again in Confirm password.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New database server settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New database server settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Leave Create V12 Server (latest update) set to Yes to use the latest features.
trans-unit.target: Leave Create V12 Server (latest update) set to Yes to use the latest features.

trans-unit.source: The Location determines the data center region where your server is created.
trans-unit.target: The Location determines the data center region where your server is created.

trans-unit.source: Create database servers in a location close to the applications that will use the database.
trans-unit.target: Create database servers in a location close to the applications that will use the database.

trans-unit.source: If you want to change the location, just click Location, pick a different one, and then click OK.
trans-unit.target: If you want to change the location, just click Location, pick a different one, and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: Click OK to go back to SQL Database blade.
trans-unit.target: Click OK to go back to SQL Database blade.

trans-unit.source: The database and server aren't created yet.
trans-unit.target: The database and server aren't created yet.

trans-unit.source: This happens after the next step, where you choose to create the database from the AdventureWorks sample and confirm settings.
trans-unit.target: This happens after the next step, where you choose to create the database from the AdventureWorks sample and confirm settings.

trans-unit.source: Step 4: Set up and create the database
trans-unit.target: Step 4: Set up and create the database

trans-unit.source: In the SQL Database blade, click Select source and then click Sample.
trans-unit.target: In the SQL Database blade, click Select source and then click Sample.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create a database from a sample</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create a database from a sample</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You go back to the SQL Database blade, where Select sample now shows AdventureWorks LT [V12].
trans-unit.target: You go back to the SQL Database blade, where Select sample now shows AdventureWorks LT [V12].

trans-unit.source: Click Create to kick off creation of the server and database.
trans-unit.target: Click Create to kick off creation of the server and database.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create a sample database</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create a sample database</linkText>

trans-unit.source: For this quick how-to, we didn't change the settings for Pricing tier, Collation, and Resource group.
trans-unit.target: For this quick how-to, we didn't change the settings for Pricing tier, Collation, and Resource group.

trans-unit.source: You can change the pricing tier of a database and scale up and down at any time, with no downtime.
trans-unit.target: You can change the pricing tier of a database and scale up and down at any time, with no downtime.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>SQL Database Pricing</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>SQL database pricing tiers</linkText><title></title></link> to learn more.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>SQL Database Pricing</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>SQL database pricing tiers</linkText><title></title></link> to learn more.

trans-unit.source: The collation of a database can't be changed once you set it up here.
trans-unit.target: The collation of a database can't be changed once you set it up here.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Collation and Unicode Support</linkText><title></title></link> for details about collation.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Collation and Unicode Support</linkText><title></title></link> for details about collation.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Azure Resource Manager Overview</linkText><title></title></link> for details about Azure resource groups.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Azure Resource Manager Overview</linkText><title></title></link> for details about Azure resource groups.

trans-unit.source: You jump back to the Azure Startboard, where a tile shows progress until the database is created and it's online.
trans-unit.target: You jump back to the Azure Startboard, where a tile shows progress until the database is created and it's online.

trans-unit.source: You can also click Browse all and then click SQL Databases to confirm the database is online.
trans-unit.target: You can also click Browse all and then click SQL Databases to confirm the database is online.

trans-unit.source: Congratulations!
trans-unit.target: Congratulations!

trans-unit.source: You now have a database running in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: You now have a database running in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: You're almost finished.
trans-unit.target: You're almost finished.

trans-unit.source: There's one key step left.
trans-unit.target: There's one key step left.

trans-unit.source: You need to create a rule on the database server so you can connect to the database.
trans-unit.target: You need to create a rule on the database server so you can connect to the database.

trans-unit.source: Step 5: Configure the firewall
trans-unit.target: Step 5: Configure the firewall

trans-unit.source: You need to set up a firewall rule on the server that allows connections from your client computer's IP address so you can work with the database.
trans-unit.target: You need to set up a firewall rule on the server that allows connections from your client computer's IP address so you can work with the database.

trans-unit.source: This not only helps make sure you can connect, it's a great way to see the area where you can get other details about your SQL servers in Azure.
trans-unit.target: This not only helps make sure you can connect, it's a great way to see the area where you can get other details about your SQL servers in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Click Browse all, scroll down and then click SQL servers, and then click the name of the server you created earlier from the list of SQL servers.
trans-unit.target: Click Browse all, scroll down and then click SQL servers, and then click the name of the server you created earlier from the list of SQL servers.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Select your database server</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Select your database server</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the database properties blade that appears to the right, click Settings and then click Firewall from the list.
trans-unit.target: In the database properties blade that appears to the right, click Settings and then click Firewall from the list.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Opening firewall settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Opening firewall settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The Firewall settings show your current Client IP address.
trans-unit.target: The Firewall settings show your current Client IP address.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Current IP address</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Current IP address</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add Client IP to have Azure create a rule for that IP address, and then click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Add Client IP to have Azure create a rule for that IP address, and then click Save.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add the IP address</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add the IP address</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You're IP address is likely to change from time to time, and you may not be able to access your server until you create a new firewall rule.
trans-unit.target: You're IP address is likely to change from time to time, and you may not be able to access your server until you create a new firewall rule.

trans-unit.source: You can check your IP address using <link><linkText>Bing</linkText><title></title></link>, and then add a single IP address or a range of IP addresses.
trans-unit.target: You can check your IP address using <link><linkText>Bing</linkText><title></title></link>, and then add a single IP address or a range of IP addresses.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>How to configure firewall settings</linkText><title></title></link> for details.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>How to configure firewall settings</linkText><title></title></link> for details.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Now that you have a database with some sample data, you're ready to explore using your favorite tools.
trans-unit.target: Now that you have a database with some sample data, you're ready to explore using your favorite tools.

trans-unit.source: If you're familiar with Transact-SQL and SQL Server Management Studio, learn how to <link><linkText>Connect and query a SQL database with SSMS</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you're familiar with Transact-SQL and SQL Server Management Studio, learn how to <link><linkText>Connect and query a SQL database with SSMS</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: If you know Excel, learn how to <link><linkText>Connect to SQL database with Excel</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you know Excel, learn how to <link><linkText>Connect to SQL database with Excel</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: If you're ready to start coding, see <link><linkText>Connect and query your SQL database with C#</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>Using SQL database from .NET (C#)</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you're ready to start coding, see <link><linkText>Connect and query your SQL database with C#</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>Using SQL database from .NET (C#)</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: See the <link><linkText>Quick start code samples to SQL Database</linkText><title></title></link> for Node.js, Python, Ruby, Java, PHP and C++ samples and how-to's in addition to C#.
trans-unit.target: See the <link><linkText>Quick start code samples to SQL Database</linkText><title></title></link> for Node.js, Python, Ruby, Java, PHP and C++ samples and how-to's in addition to C#.

trans-unit.source: If you want to move your on-premises SQL Server databases to Azure, see <link><linkText>Migrating a database to Azure SQL Database</linkText><title></title></link> to learn more.
trans-unit.target: If you want to move your on-premises SQL Server databases to Azure, see <link><linkText>Migrating a database to Azure SQL Database</linkText><title></title></link> to learn more.
